topic.title: How to login on ZeroMe after deleting the zite?
topic.body:
I was having some difficulties with zerome so I deleted and redownloaded it. 
It gave me the option to select a certificate, I selected the one I had been using previously.
It said I had to create a new account, I tried selecting my old hub and it gives an error saying the user already exists.

What do I do?

topic.title: Learn to insert links in your post.
topic.body: ZeroTalk supports the markdown language. Markdown is like a simplified html. It's what is used to write github README files. To insert a link type: \[example\]\(https://example.com/) the result is: [example](https://example.com/)

topic.title: [Suggestion] Zeronet to show a warning on "clear net" links
topic.body:
It would be nice for zero net to show links to the "clear net" with some kind of visual warning or to show a popup warning when you click on them and before opening. It would be a nice privacy feature if you don't always use the TOR Browser.

Github doesn't like disposable emails so I'm posting it here.

topic.title: youtube-dl taken down by DMCA (backups provided)
topic.body:
See for yourselves: https://github.com/ytdl-org/youtube-dl/releases/download/2020.09.20/youtube-dl-2020.09.20.tar.gz

I made a IFS mirror, it has the pypi wheel (installation file), the tar.gz (that you can just extract and run) and the git repo.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/12MVkvYGcRW6u2NYbpfwVad1oQeyG4s9Er/index.html?view:item+id:15f1_15cApprVFcr1skAkWssq5aAXKa7pDwJJve_item_2+type:archive

Please toggle: "Help distribute added optional files" to help distribute the files.

UPDATE: @youtube-dl put it on git center: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/?1CXohM8XBz3mUGUR8w9CYXqdYt5JzfoPfi

1585616782_1BpmfrtYDwDy6ERRr8jLb5mavzRuT.body: Be aware that folding at home is proprietary.

> [styromaniac](#comment_2005_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd):  What about BOINC?

folding at home does not use BOINC. rosetta at home does use BOINC but the work units are proprietary nevertheless.
SETI@home uses BOINC and the work units are free software, unfortunately it has come to an hiatus a few weeks ago. Otherwise you could contribute to it and then ask the aliens for help.

1585207808_1KtNz7B6oMUBcPKCTZuSTbphZ2s7R.body: If the government is blocking connections physically, [OSI layer 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OSI_model), then TOR won't work because it's on OSI layer 4. You would need an alternative OSI layer 1. In the scenario you purpose the easiest option is a wireless mesh network. It can use radio(best for long range) or wifi(best for bandwidth). One project that helps create such networks is [Hyperboria](https://hyperboria.net/). There already is a substantial [hyperboria network in New York city](https://www.nycmesh.net/).

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_987_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): I think Tor would continue to work. Why not? If people within blocked country setup Tor exit and relay nodes. Then i do not know why Tor would not work... Though if one is using Tor for clearnet browsing to anonymize, then the exit node would be in same country, so possibly lower protection from government.

If the government literally cut the cables and jam all radio bridges are of little use. Bridges can get around the chinese firewall because it doesn't simply clock everything. They can still access random IPs.

1585933227_15cApprVFcr1skAkWssq5aAXKa7pD.body:
> [rex4539@kxoid.bit](#comment_11_18F1Ga3hcY5ZSPoD5jeFow6w7uHyRtocdf): If you want to use ZeroNet as a decentralized, uncensorable platform, then you don't necessarily need to use Tor Browser. [...]

I'm aware. But it's a very simple addition and helps a lot if you want to stay anonymous. It doesn't need to be on by default.

> [styromaniac](#comment_2010_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): On Android, you can block clearnet access to the browser with a firewall app. [...]
Is there a simple way of doing this? (with ublock and umatrix)

> [rannulfr](#comment_61_17ThiaUZmUKD2nEKkvUN6iCvaa1F3GBY51): Far easier way is to just use a separate physical pfsense firewall made from an old computer. Push all your traffic through TOR as well as through a paid VPN. No traffic should flow if not through TOR and VPN. There are hundreds of videos and guides how to do this.

What if I just want zeronet to go through tor? I just don't want random people seeing my IP address. I don't mind directly accessing normal websites.
I could also have more than one ZeroID that I would like to keep apart from each other.

1586074982_1CcmrTeqtuoQtUpuxBZ9wFZz1tPaB.body: I haven't researched the subject but when the parliament does such a thing there usually is a set date for things to go back to normal. So it *might* not be a dictatorship yet. It could also be that if it really turns into a dictatorship it will get kicked of the EU and become russia's bitch.

1585525602_1DoVPxFrQCDb3grC8Nsn6aACed9o2.body: This COVID thing really is affecting the schizos.

1593195001_13gz7jEayVZjubcAGS16kR3Ze4RJS.body:
Reminder that:
The government is an institution that we create to help us do things that would otherwise be too difficult. It has no mission besides that. It has no rights.
It is perfectly fine for you to say that state surveillance goes against your personal values.
It is perfectly fine for you to say that you don't trust the government.
It is perfectly fine for you to say that the fight against terrorism is not worth the risk of a surveillance state.

1603487223_15cApprVFcr1skAkWssq5aAXKa7pD.body:
> [ludeti](#comment_17_1ETarTu7fyokpgRoBMiGZc8L3FwnDTGstL): Please toggle: "Help distribute added optional files" to help distribute the files.

Digital Millennium Copyright Act, a very poorly written american law. They have tried to pull the same with Popcorn-Time and the repo was re-instantiated. But the claim was slightly different.

https://torrentfreak.com/github-reinstates-popcorn-time-code-despite-mpa-threat-200520/

> [xcape2net](#comment_793_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): Downloading the youtube downloader will not do any good, because every few months Youtube manages to make it stop working.  The only thing that has kept it functional all this time is frequent updates.  If there are no more updates, it will be useless in a few months.

If someone wants to take over the project they will need the source code. 
Some people might not be on latest version.



> [styromaniac](#comment_2608_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): 

>Also, ZeroNet is not considered a piracy tool. It doesn't rip DRM'd media. It can have original, licensed content. Feds would go after BitTorrent long before they go after ZeroNet.

Their claim was that youtube-dl was a tool **meant to distribute their** copyrighted content specifically. 
The claim about the "rolling cipher" is vague and probably thrown there to scare the github employees and youtube-dl devs. Otherwise they would have gone after jDownloader, invidious or FreeTube, all of which are much more normie friendly.

> [youtubedl](#comment_1_1FbRrp2tcr9ksaNJRRT1Q2Jzw8PBXaFXPg): let's mirror it over GitCenter (git over zeronet) as well

I tried but kept getting an error.

> [styromaniac](#comment_2606_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): Helping to distribute added optional files is not what you want unless you want to seed a whole hub.

It says on the side bar how large that optional files are. It is not the whole hub.
It seems like they have not given up: https://yt-dl.org/

1603374060_1E1y7xgzGJZzFvxUsjsXWk3YnBoGG.body: I came across it a long time ago. Do normal torrents work with it?

Meaning it will be backwards compatible?

> [oscarwilde](#comment_3_1Qq4LP4T9LVbrnWLcUiQCXkMXJfPR1TTG): If RMS isn't using his position to explain that free software running on american designed CPUs is a theater he is useless anyways, may he rest out of the spotlight.

The FSF has a list of "hardware that respects your freedom" but it doesn't automatically exclude hardware based on where it's designed or manufactured.
